title: Trust me, it WILL destroy the world
body:
My employer is a very, very dangerous man.

If he wasn't, perhaps I wouldn't be writing this, perhaps he'd have been strangled, lying dead in the foyer of his 16,000 square foot mansion.

Perhaps.

But the reality is that I'm writing this, cowering in a bush, desperately trying to get away from that creep.

He ALWAYS wore a grey suit, and a red tie that was a bit too short and a bit too loose. He was also INSANELY paranoid.

Have you heard of Qin Shi Huangdi? That man was the first emperor of China, and he was paranoid enough to sleep in a different room of his castle every night.

He was also obsessed with finding a potion to grant him immortality.

My employer and Qin Shi Huangdi are very alike. Both, powerful men, who want nothing more than to "break" their limitations and are paranoid enough to go to any extent to accomplish their goals.

For the entire time that I knew him, I knew my employer by the name of Lee. He was too cunning to even provide us with a fake last name. Now I say US, because, remember, this is a 16,000 square foot mansion, so there were at least a few others involved in patrolling and "bodyguarding" the mansion.

The mansion itself was a big, grey, Victorian sort of thing, located in basically the middle of nowhere. That's how Lee was able to change his address every day, without any neighbors noticing.

Now I knew that was weird, but when you're paid 5 grand a day to essentially stand around and do nothing, you learn to keep your mouth shut.

I imagine that if you're a cop, earning a measly salary, and you're paid double what you get in a year PER MONTH, you learn to keep your mouth shut.

So you see, Lee had weaved an intricate web around himself. He'd had himself COMPLETELY protected from all sides. There was nothing anyone could do to harm him.

Nobody knew how he'd made his fortune, but we had our suspicions. And with the number of shady dealers that entered and left the place, we had an inkling that he was a drug supplier.

But if that was it, I wouldn't have really cared.

After my first day, I saw the other guys looking at me, and then immediately looking away, hiding their faces. I still don't know whether they felt sorry for me, or if they knew that they were next.

One by one, they all disappeared. And every time they did, there was another replacement.

I don't know why he's kept me around for so long. There's been three complete rotations of staff since I joined. Everyone's disappeared. Everone except for me.

Maybe he hates me, and that's why he's kept me around for so long: to watch me break down before he ends me. Maybe he likes me and sees a little of himself in me.

Maybe.

I didn't know what Lee was doing with them until yesterday. I was walking around, conducting my routine checks, when I stumbled upon him.

I don't really know what his post is called, but the man reminded me of an opossum, a cunning little thing, but quite little and easily killed if you knew its tricks nonetheless.

Now, the man used to watch Lee's "experiments", and I suppose that's what drove him to insanity, and that's why I found him curled up in a ball murmuring to himself, and holding the tape that contained Lee's plans.

I didn't hesitate to snatch up the tape and watch it.

What I wouldn't give to go back and never do that again.

You see, Lee had been training the other guards, breeding them for his "ultimate test". The sicko decided that his new drug was "the savior" of mankind and wanted to test it out.

Lee's methods were always the same, as I saw on the tape(it was a compilation of different guards). He'd always tell the guards they were being let go, and then give them a "final meal", where he'd secretly sipped in the drug.

I suppose it truly was their "final meal", atleast as humans.

The drug, called "angel", would then go into effect, with each guard suddenly spawning black, crow-like wings, their limbs elongating, and their eyes closing to slits. Lee had been doing this for five years, and the only thing these "angels" ate was the drug itself.

I now understand why that man lost his sanity. It's because yesterday, Lee finally reached his goal. He had over 50 "angels", and he put them in a pen together.

They fought savagely, like animals, ripping each other apart and devouring each other as though they hadn't had a meal in days. Finally, 10 "winners" turned back into humans and looked around, astonished at where they were.

I heard Lee's voice cackling in the background, saying he'd finally weed out the weak in Humanity.

I'm writing this because Lee doesn't just have connections with dealers. He has connections with everyone.

In 2 days, "angel" goes global. Every major fast food company, frozen food company, drink company, etc., will have their food injected with "angel".

Every drug, antibiotic, and vaccine will have a small dosage of "angel" implanted in it.

Lee knows the workers, the CEO's, and the politicians to make it happen. And he'll stop at NOTHING to make his paradise a reality.

In two days, the world ends.
author: LitLegend27
